# init()

**Initializer**

Creates a default timestamp result.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Discussion

Metal creates [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterResultTimestamp] instances for you when you resolve the counter set’s data (see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/converting-a-gpus-counter-data-into-a-readable-format]). There’s no reason for you to manually create one in your app.

## Swift support

- **init(timestamp:)**: Creates a timestamp result from a value.

items.description: Creates a timestamp result from a value.
items.name: init(timestamp:)
